steps.title: Open ‚ÄúAdd Task‚Äù modal
details: Users clicked the Add-Task (+) button; modal appeared. Minor UI inconsistencies in button style and spacing were noted.

steps.title: Fill task details (name, description, deadline)
details: Typing worked, but typography, label alignment and padding looked off in every screen.

steps.title: Choose category
details: Dropdown opened and a category (üè¢ Work, etc.) was selected. The open menu remained on-screen. Color contrast issue flagged.

steps.title: Create Task (submit form)
details: In two separate tests the click on ‚ÄúCreate Task‚Äù timed-out because the still-open category menu intercepted the pointer. Core flow blocked.

steps.title: System feedback after create
details: Where the click failed, no feedback was shown (hard stop). In the tests where it passed, success messages were unclear or absent; users had to scroll/look around to confirm creation.

steps.title: Re-ordering & pinning tasks
details: Because task creation failed, move/reorder/pin scenarios never executed.

steps.title: Mark task as done
details: One end-to-end run succeeded; checkbox updated task state, but visual change required multiple clicks to notice.

steps.title: Mark task as NOT done
details: Visual state reverted, but the app displayed no confirmation message, causing the automated check to fail.

steps.title: Add new category
details: Whole scenario remained pending; likely blocked by earlier reliability issues.

emotional_arc: Starts confident (app loads) ‚Üí mild discomfort (inconsistent visuals) ‚Üí rising frustration (open dropdown blocks Create-Task) ‚Üí confusion (no success confirmation) ‚Üí relief in one long run that finally completes ‚Üí disappointment when status-change shows no notification.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Form submission obstructed by open dropdown
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Primary task flow (creating a task) fails; users cannot proceed.
next_actions: Automatically close the category menu as soon as a selection is made.
Or place the Create-Task button outside the dropdown‚Äôs z-index area.
Add escape-key / outside-click handlers to dismiss overlays.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Lack of explicit success & status messages
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users are uncertain whether an action (create / mark done / mark not done) worked.
next_actions: Trigger toast or inline alert after every CRUD action.
Write concise, friendly copy: ‚ÄúTask created üéâ‚Äù / ‚ÄúTask marked complete‚Äù.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent UI erodes trust and makes scanning harder, especially in forms and lists.
next_actions: Define design tokens for font sizes, weights, spacing.
Audit components against tokens; update modal inputs & buttons.
Run automated linting (stylelint) or component tests to catch regressions.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Insufficient contrast hurts accessibility (WCAG) and brand perception.
next_actions: Check palette against WCAG AA/AAA using automated tools.
Adjust foreground/background pairs; document brand color usage.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users had to scroll and hunt to verify newly added tasks.
next_actions: Auto-scroll or highlight newly added task.
Optionally collapse the form after success to reveal the list.
Provide filter/sort so new items are obvious.

first_tackles.description: Fix overlay-intercept bug so ‚ÄúCreate Task‚Äù click always works (close dropdown or adjust z-index).
Add clear toast/snackbar confirmations for create / update / revert actions.
Standardise typography & spacing using a shared style guide to remove the most visible visual inconsistencies.
Improve color contrast on buttons and text to reach WCAG AA.
Auto-focus or highlight the newly created task in the list to reassure users their action succeeded.
